chapter.title: Messaging in Seam
chapter.para: Seam makes it easy to send and receive JMS messages to and from Seam components.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: To configure Seam's infrastructure for sending JMS messages, you need to tell Seam about any topics and queues you want to send messages to, and also tell Seam where to find the QueueConnectionFactory and/or TopicConnectionFactory.

Seam defaults to using UIL2ConnectionFactory which is the usual connection factory for use with JBossMQ. If you are using some other JMS provider, you need to set one or both of queueConnection.queueConnectionFactoryJndiName and topicConnection.topicConnectionFactoryJndiName in seam.properties, web.xml or components.xml.

section.title: Receiving messages using a message-driven bean
section.para: You can process messages using any EJB3 message driven bean. Message-driven beans may even be Seam components, in which case it is possible to inject other event and application scoped Seam components.

section.title: Receiving messages in the client
section.para: Seam Remoting lets you subscribe to a JMS topic from client-side JavaScript. This is described in the next chapter.
